ui_ux_improvements.title: Add Keyboard Trap to Dialog Component
ui_ux_improvements.description: Implement ESC key handling and focus trap for the Dialog component to improve accessibility and user experience
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The Dialog component currently only closes via backdrop click. Users expect to close modals with the ESC key, which is a standard UX pattern and WCAG accessibility requirement. Focus should also be trapped within the dialog while open.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Dialog component renders a backdrop that closes on click, but has no keyboard event listeners. No ESC key handling, no focus trap implementation. The component just renders children without trapping keyboard focus inside.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change:
1. Add useEffect hook to listen for 'keydown' events on document
2. Close dialog when ESC key is pressed (event.key === 'Escape')
3. Add focus trap using useRef to track focusable elements
4. On open, focus the first focusable element
5. On Tab, cycle through focusable elements within dialog
6. Add aria-modal='true' and role='dialog' to DialogContent
7. Clean up event listeners on unmount
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users can close dialogs with ESC key as expected. Screen reader users get proper modal semantics. Keyboard-only users can navigate within the dialog without focus escaping to background content.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Remove Debug Information from AssistantMessage
ui_ux_improvements.description: Remove the visible debug info section that displays view mode, tool counts, and status in the AssistantMessage component
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The AssistantMessage component displays debug information (line 446-448) that shows 'View: {viewMode} | Tools: {allToolUses.length} | System: {allSystemMessages.length} | Status: {message?.status?.type}' directly in the UI. This is development-only information that should not be visible to end users.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Lines 446-448 render a div with debug info inside every assistant message bubble: 'View: {viewMode} | Tools: {allToolUses.length} | System: {allSystemMessages.length} | Status: {message?.status?.type}'. This creates visual clutter and exposes internal state to users.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change:
1. Remove the debug div entirely (lines 446-448) from MessageBubble.tsx
2. Alternatively, wrap in a conditional that checks process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' if debug info is needed during development
3. Consider using React DevTools or a dedicated debug panel instead
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Cleaner chat interface without confusing technical information. Professional appearance in production. Reduced visual noise in the message area.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Add Ghost and Outline Button Variants
ui_ux_improvements.description: Extend the Button component to include 'ghost' and 'outline' variants for subtle actions and icon buttons
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The Button component only has primary, secondary, and destructive variants. Many UI patterns require ghost buttons (transparent background, text color only) and outline buttons (transparent with border). These are commonly used for icon buttons, toolbar actions, and less prominent CTAs.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Button variantClasses object only defines: primary (bg-primary), secondary (bg-secondary), and destructive (bg-destructive). No ghost or outline variants exist. Currently, developers may use className overrides to achieve similar effects, leading to inconsistent styling.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change:
1. Add 'ghost' variant: 'hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground' (transparent bg, shows on hover)
2. Add 'outline' variant: 'border border-input bg-background hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground'
3. Update ButtonProps interface to include new variants
4. Add 'icon' size: 'h-10 w-10' for square icon buttons
5. Update JSDoc examples to show new variants
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Developers get consistent, reusable button styles for all common use cases. Icon buttons and toolbar actions look consistent. Better visual hierarchy with subtle button options.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Create Consistent Skeleton Loading Component
ui_ux_improvements.description: Create a reusable Skeleton component for consistent loading states across all pages
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Multiple components use different loading patterns: MCPServersPage uses a spinner, DashboardPage has loading states, TasksPage shows different indicators. A consistent skeleton/loading component would improve perceived performance and provide a unified loading experience.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: Loading states are inconsistent: MCPServersPage shows a spinner icon with 'text-primary animate-spin', DashboardPage has 'loading' boolean conditionals, TasksPage shows 'Loading tasks...' text. No unified skeleton component exists. Some pages have no loading indication at all.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change:
1. Create src/web/manager/components/ui/Skeleton.tsx component
2. Implement base skeleton with pulse animation: 'animate-pulse rounded-md bg-muted'
3. Add variants: SkeletonCard, SkeletonList, SkeletonTable
4. Create SkeletonAgentCard matching AgentsPage card layout
5. Create SkeletonServerRow matching MCPServersPage row layout
6. Replace spinner-based loading with skeleton layouts
7. Use Content-aware skeletons that match actual content shape
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Faster perceived loading times. Users see content shape immediately. Consistent loading experience across all pages. Reduced layout shift when content loads.

ui_ux_improvements.title: Enhance Empty States with Icons and CTAs
ui_ux_improvements.description: Improve empty state displays across all pages with consistent icons, helpful messaging, and clear call-to-action buttons
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Current empty states are minimal text like 'No agents found in .claude/agents/' or 'No MCP Servers Found'. These miss opportunities to guide users with visual feedback, helpful hints, and clear next actions. Good empty states reduce confusion and increase engagement.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: AgentsPage line 294-295: 'No agents found in .claude/agents/' as plain centered text. MCPServersPage has slightly better empty state with icon and CTA. Most pages just show muted text without icons, illustrations, or clear guidance on what to do next.
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change:
1. Create EmptyState component with props: icon, title, description, actionLabel, onAction
2. Add relevant Lucide icons for each empty state (e.g., CpuChipIcon for agents, PuzzlePieceIcon for skills)
3. Include helpful description explaining what this section is for
4. Add primary CTA button matching page's create action
5. Use consistent padding (py-16), centered layout, max-w-md for text
6. Apply to all list pages: Agents, Skills, Flows, Commands, MCP Servers, Tasks
7. Example structure: Icon (64x64 text-muted) + Title (text-lg font-medium) + Description (text-sm text-muted) + Button
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users understand what each section is for even when empty. Clear guidance on how to create first item. Visual consistency across all empty states. Reduced confusion for new users.
